request_pathways.name: Fax to HH/IOL Health Information Management
Mail to HH/IOL Health Information Management, 80 Seymour St, Bliss 104, Hartford, CT 06102

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (Institute of Living variant)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a system-wide generic HIPAA authorization form, prints and fills it by hand, and faxes or mails it to the appropriate HHC facility's HIM department.

red_flags: Stale URL for form returns 404; older search results lead to dead link
Confusing dual-purpose 'disclose/obtain' structure not explained for patient self-access
Outdated 2012 Institute of Living form (form-2) still publicly accessible with missing legal notices
bright_spots: Comprehensive facility directory with fax numbers for all 11 HHC facilities on the form itself
Connecticut-specific legal notices for HIV, psychiatric, substance abuse, and reproductive health records
Purpose of disclosure marked '(Optional)' — correctly implements HIPAA patient rights
Sensitive information categories broken out as separate opt-in checkboxes

findability.rationale: Level 3: Requires moderate effort — form is on the parent system's medical records page (not hartfordhospital.org), a previously indexed URL returns 404, and the current URL uses an opaque numeric filename.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds — form has a text layer (annotation tools work) but zero fillable fields; fax submission is available via listed fax numbers for all facilities.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but has notable problems — the form is logically organized and concise at 2 pages, but opens with staff-facing fields, uses dense legalistic language, and the disclose/obtain structure is confusing for patients.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the generic authorization form serves third-party release equally, with no dedicated pathway or simplified section for patient self-access under HIPAA Right of Access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing that would materially impede a patient — includes non-conditioning statement, revocation rights, right to inspect, and optional purpose field; no notarization or fee barriers; minor gap in not citing HIPAA § 164.524 or specifying response timeframes.

overall.summary: Hartford Hospital provides a functional but generic records request process through its parent system's non-fillable authorization form; patients can submit by fax but must navigate a form designed for third-party release with no dedicated patient access pathway.
